verses.kjv: But Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
verses.ct: "Listen carefully to what I have to say, and let that be the comfort you offer me.

verses.kjv: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
verses.ct: Bear with me while I speak, and after I'm done, you can go ahead and mock me.

verses.kjv: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
verses.ct: Is my complaint directed at a human being? No! So why shouldn't my spirit be troubled?

verses.kjv: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
verses.ct: Look at me and be shocked — put your hand over your mouth in silence.

verses.kjv: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
verses.ct: When I even think about this, I'm filled with dread, and my whole body shakes.

verses.kjv: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
verses.ct: Why do wicked people keep on living, growing old, and becoming more and more powerful?

verses.kjv: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
verses.ct: Their children are established right alongside them, and their descendants thrive before their very eyes.

verses.kjv: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
verses.ct: Their homes are safe and free from danger, and God's punishment never falls on them.

verses.kjv: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
verses.ct: Their bulls breed without fail; their cows give birth and never lose their calves.

verses.kjv: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
verses.ct: They send their little children out to play like a flock, and their kids dance around.

verses.kjv: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
verses.ct: They sing along with tambourines and harps, and celebrate to the sound of flutes.

verses.kjv: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
verses.ct: They spend their lives in prosperity, and then they go peacefully to the grave in an instant.

verses.kjv: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
verses.ct: Yet they say to God, 'Leave us alone! We have no interest in knowing your ways.'

verses.kjv: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
verses.ct: 'Who is the Almighty that we should serve him? What do we gain by praying to him?'

verses.kjv: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.ct: But look — their prosperity is not really in their own hands. The mindset of the wicked is something I want no part of.

verses.kjv: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
verses.ct: How often is the lamp of the wicked actually snuffed out? How often does disaster really strike them? How often does God distribute suffering to them in his anger?

verses.kjv: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
verses.ct: How often are they like straw blown by the wind, or like chaff swept away by a storm?

verses.kjv: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
verses.ct: You say, 'God stores up a person's punishment for their children.' But let him repay the person directly, so they experience it themselves!

verses.kjv: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.ct: Let their own eyes witness their ruin; let them personally drink from the fury of the Almighty.

verses.kjv: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
verses.ct: What do they care about their family after they're gone, once their allotted months have been cut short?

verses.kjv: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
verses.ct: Can anyone teach God knowledge? After all, he is the one who judges even the highest beings.

verses.kjv: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
verses.ct: One person dies at the peak of health, completely at ease and content.

verses.kjv: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
verses.ct: Their body is well-nourished, and their bones are full of marrow.

verses.kjv: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
verses.ct: Another person dies with a bitter soul, never having enjoyed anything good.

verses.kjv: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
verses.ct: Both of them end up the same way — lying in the dirt, covered by worms.

verses.kjv: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
verses.ct: I already know what you're thinking and the arguments you're scheming to use against me.

verses.kjv: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
verses.ct: You ask, 'Where is the mansion of the powerful oppressor? Where is the home where the wicked once lived?'

verses.kjv: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,
verses.ct: Haven't you talked to travelers? Don't you recognize the evidence they bring back?

verses.kjv: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
verses.ct: The truth is that the wicked person is often spared on the day of disaster; they are carried safely through the day of fury.

verses.kjv: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?
verses.ct: Who confronts them about their behavior to their face? Who pays them back for what they've done?

verses.kjv: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
verses.ct: They are carried to the cemetery with honor and a guard is kept over their tomb.

verses.kjv: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
verses.ct: The soil of the valley rests gently on them, and everyone follows in their funeral procession, just as countless others went before them.

verses.kjv: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
verses.ct: So how can you comfort me with such empty words, when everything you've said is full of lies?"
